definitions: To place (documents, etc.) in a file or among other papers in a methodical manner for preservation or reference.
To submit (a legal document, application, etc.) to be officially recorded or dealt with.
To walk in a line, one behind the other.
To use a file as a tool to smooth or shape something.
examples: She files all her invoices alphabetically.
The lawyer files a motion with the court.
The students files out of the classroom.
He files down the rough edges of the wood.
